title: FABER Workflow Schema
description: JSON Schema for FABER workflow files. Workflows can extend other workflows via the 'extends' field, creating an inheritance chain where parent pre_steps run before and post_steps run after child workflow steps.

$schema.description: JSON Schema reference for IDE validation

asset_type.description: The type of asset this workflow operates on (e.g., 'software-feature', 'blog-post', 'dataset', 'video', 'catalog'). Identifies what kind of thing the workflow creates, modifies, or manages. Projects may have multiple workflows operating on different asset types.

workflow_type.description: Template type this workflow was created from (e.g., 'asset-create'). Links to templates in templates/workflows/{workflow_type}/. Optional - existing workflows without this field continue to work.

extends.description: Parent workflow to extend. Use namespaced format: 'fractary-faber:default' for core workflows, or unnamespaced for project workflows. Parent pre_steps execute before child steps, parent post_steps execute after.

skip_steps.description: Step IDs from parent workflows to skip. Allows selective exclusion of inherited steps without abandoning the entire parent workflow.

hooks.description: DEPRECATED: Use pre_steps and post_steps in phase definitions instead. Hooks will be removed in v3.0.

critical_artifacts.description: Configuration for critical artifacts that must be maintained in context during workflow execution. Used for context management across sessions and compaction.

context.description: Context overlays that inject additional instructions into inherited steps without forking. Context cascades: global → phase → step. Accumulates across inheritance chain (ancestor prepends to child).

pre_steps.description: Steps to execute BEFORE child workflow steps. In inheritance, parent pre_steps run before child pre_steps.

steps.description: Main phase steps. These are the core steps for this phase.

post_steps.description: Steps to execute AFTER child workflow steps. In inheritance, child post_steps run before parent post_steps.

max_retries.description: Maximum retry attempts for this phase

require_approval.description: Whether this phase requires explicit approval

id.description: Unique step identifier (lowercase, hyphens allowed). MUST be unique across the entire merged workflow (including inherited steps). Required for step targeting, logging, state tracking, and skip_steps.

name.description: Human-readable display name for the step.

description.description: Human-readable step documentation (what this step does)

prompt.description: PRIMARY execution instruction. Can be: (1) a slash command (e.g., '/fractary-repo:commit'), (2) freeform text instruction for Claude to execute directly, or (3) a description of what to do. Takes precedence over command and description fields.

context.description: Optional additional context to provide when executing the prompt. Used to customize or clarify the execution without modifying the prompt itself. Appended to prompt during execution.

command.description: DEPRECATED: Use 'prompt' field instead. Command reference in format /plugin:command-name. Will be migrated to prompt field in future versions.

skill.description: DEPRECATED: Skill reference in format plugin:skill-name. Use 'command' field instead for deterministic execution. Will be removed in FABER v3.0.

config.description: Step-specific configuration passed to the skill or command

arguments.description: Explicit arguments to pass to the step. Keys are argument names (exact casing), values are literals or {placeholder} references to workflow context.

hooks.description: DEPRECATED: Use pre_steps and post_steps in phase definitions instead.

hook.description: DEPRECATED: Convert to pre_steps or post_steps instead.

path.description: Path to document or script (required for document and script types)

pause_before_release.description: Pause before release phase for approval

require_approval_for.description: List of actions requiring explicit approval

step_result_handling.description: Defines behavior for step execution outcomes. Optional - if omitted, defaults are: on_success='continue', on_warning='continue', on_failure='stop'. Values can be action strings ('continue', 'prompt', 'stop') or slash commands (e.g., '/fractary-faber:workflow-debugger') that are invoked with step context.

on_success.description: Action when step succeeds: 'continue' proceeds automatically (default), 'prompt' asks user, or a slash command to invoke

on_warning.description: Action when step has warnings: 'continue' proceeds (default), 'prompt' asks user, 'stop' halts workflow, or a slash command to invoke

on_failure.description: Action when step fails: 'stop' halts workflow (default), or a slash command to invoke for recovery. The command receives step context and can return a recovery plan.

hook_result_handling.description: DEPRECATED: Defines behavior for hook execution outcomes.

on_success.description: Action when hook succeeds: 'continue' proceeds automatically (default), 'prompt' asks user

on_warning.description: Action when hook has warnings: 'continue' proceeds (default), 'prompt' asks user with options, 'stop' halts workflow

on_failure.description: Action when hook fails: 'stop' halts workflow (default), 'continue' for informational hooks only

step_result.description: Standard result structure that ALL steps must return. See plugins/faber/config/schemas/skill-response.schema.json for complete schema.

status.description: Execution outcome status: 'success' = goal achieved, 'warning' = goal achieved with concerns, 'failure' = goal NOT achieved

message.description: Human-readable summary of what happened (1-2 sentences)

details.description: Operation-specific structured data (artifacts, metrics, paths, etc.)

errors.description: List of error messages (required when status is 'failure')

warnings.description: List of warning messages (required when status is 'warning')

error_analysis.description: Root cause analysis for failures - explains what went wrong and why

warning_analysis.description: Impact assessment for warnings - explains potential consequences

suggested_fixes.description: Actionable recovery suggestions, ordered by likelihood of success

critical_artifacts.description: Defines critical artifacts that must be maintained in context during workflow execution. Supports automatic reload on session start, phase transitions, and manual triggering.

always_load.description: Artifacts that are always loaded regardless of workflow state or phase

conditional_load.description: Artifacts loaded only when specific conditions are met

phase_specific.description: Phase-specific artifacts (loaded only during specific phases)

artifact.description: Defines a critical artifact that must be maintained in context

type.description: Type of artifact: json (JSON file), markdown (Markdown file), directory (directory of files), work_plugin (fetch via work plugin), skill (fetch via skill), git_info (git command output)

path.description: Static file path. Supports placeholders: {run_id}, {plan_id}, {project_root}, {work_id}. Required for json, markdown, directory types.

path_from_state.description: JSONPath expression to extract path from state file (e.g., 'artifacts.spec_path'). Alternative to static path. Required for conditional artifacts.

command.description: Slash command or git command to fetch artifact (e.g., '/fractary-work:issue-fetch {work_id}' or 'git log --oneline -20'). Required for work_plugin, skill, git_info types.

required.description: If true, workflow cannot proceed without this artifact. If false, missing artifact is logged but workflow continues.

condition.description: JavaScript expression evaluated against state (e.g., 'state.work_id != null'). Artifact loads only if condition is true. Optional.

reload_triggers.description: When to reload this artifact. Valid triggers: session_start, phase_start:{phase}, phase_transition:{from}->{to}, manual, compaction_detected

load_strategy.description: For directory type: 'all' loads all files, 'latest_only' loads most recent file, 'summary' loads a summary. Default: 'all'

context_overlays.description: Context overlays that inject additional instructions into inherited steps without forking. Context cascades: global → phase → step.

global.description: Context appended to ALL steps in ALL phases. Use for project-wide standards, conventions, or constraints.

phases.description: Phase-specific context that applies to all steps within a phase.

frame.description: Context for all steps in the frame phase

architect.description: Context for all steps in the architect phase

build.description: Context for all steps in the build phase

evaluate.description: Context for all steps in the evaluate phase

release.description: Context for all steps in the release phase

steps.description: Step-specific context by step ID. Applies to inherited steps without redefining them. Keys are step IDs.
